skill.name: implementing-with-tdd
skill.description: Use when implementing bug fixes, features, or any code changes where test-first development is appropriate.
skill.summary: Use when implementing bug fixes, features, or any code changes where test-first development is appro...
skill.author: BPSAI

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and guidance. No executable code, no network access, no file system modifications. This is a safe, read-only workflow guide.

content.value_statement: Writing tests before code ensures reliable, maintainable software. This skill guides developers through TDD cycles including test creation, red-green-refactor workflow, and project-specific testing conventions.
limitations: Does not execute code or tests

use_cases.title: Feature implementation
use_cases.description: Add new features following TDD methodology with pytest tests

use_cases.title: Bug fix verification
use_cases.description: Reproduce bugs with failing tests before implementing fixes

use_cases.title: Code review preparation
use_cases.description: Ensure code changes have comprehensive test coverage

prompt_templates.title: New feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Use implementing-with-tdd skill to add a new feature. Start with task update and write failing tests first.

prompt_templates.title: Bug fix
prompt_templates.prompt: Use implementing-with-tdd skill to fix the bug. Write a test that reproduces the issue before implementing the fix.

prompt_templates.title: Refactoring
prompt_templates.prompt: Use implementing-with-tdd skill to refactor. Ensure tests pass before and after changes using pytest.

prompt_templates.title: Full TDD cycle
prompt_templates.prompt: Guide me through a complete TDD cycle: update task status, write failing test, implement code, verify green, refactor, and complete task.

output_examples.input: Use implementing-with-tdd to add user authentication feature

best_practices: Always run tests in red-green-refactor order to verify each step
Use descriptive test names following project conventions
Run the full CI suite (bpsai-pair ci) before marking complete
Mock external services in unit tests to ensure isolation
anti_patterns: Writing implementation code before tests (violates TDD)
Skipping test execution and assuming code works
Leaving failing tests in the codebase
Modifying tests to pass instead of fixing the implementation

faq.question: What tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Provides commands for pytest, ruff, and bpsai-pair CLI.

faq.question: How long should a TDD cycle take?
faq.answer: Keep cycles short. Write one failing test, implement minimum code, verify pass. Typical cycle is 5-15 minutes.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with CI/CD?
faq.answer: Yes. Run bpsai-pair ci locally before pushing. It executes tests, linting, and type checks.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-based skill with no code execution. It only provides guidance for manual workflows.

faq.question: What if tests fail unexpectedly?
faq.answer: Run pytest --lf to re-run only failed tests. Use pytest -x to stop on first failure for debugging.

faq.question: How is this different from other testing skills?
faq.answer: This skill is specific to PairCoder project conventions with custom commands, fixtures, and task workflow integration.
